title: Local Construction
statementHtml:
An element bibi (1≤i≤m1≤i≤m) in an array b1,b2,…,bmb1,b2,…,bm is a local minimum if at least one of the following holds:

Similarly, an element bibi (1≤i≤m1≤i≤m) in an array b1,b2,…,bmb1,b2,…,bm is a local maximum if at least one of the following holds:

Note that local minima and maxima are not defined for arrays with only one element.

There is a hidden permutation∗∗ pp of length nn. The following two operations are applied to permutation pp alternately, starting from operation 1, until there is only one element left in pp:

More specifically, operation 1 is applied during every odd iteration, and operation 2 is applied during every even iteration, until there is only one element left in pp.

For each index ii (1≤i≤n1≤i≤n), let aiai be the iteration number that element pipi is removed, or −1−1 if it was never removed.

It can be proven that there will be only one element left in pp after at most ⌈log2n⌉⌈log2⁡n⌉ iterations (in other words, ai≤⌈log2n⌉ai≤⌈log2⁡n⌉).

You are given the array a1,a2,…,ana1,a2,…,an. Your task is to construct any permutation pp of nn elements that satisfies array aa.

∗∗A permutation of length nn is an array consisting of nn distinct integers from 11 to nn in arbitrary order. For example, [2,3,1,5,4][2,3,1,5,4] is a permutation, but [1,2,2][1,2,2] is not a permutation (22 appears twice in the array), and [1,3,4][1,3,4] is also not a permutation (n=3n=3 but there is 44 in the array).
inputSpecHtml:
Each test contains multiple test cases. The first line contains the number of test cases tt (1≤t≤1041≤t≤104). The description of the test cases follows.

The first line of each test case contains a single integer nn (2≤n≤2⋅1052≤n≤2⋅105) — the number of elements in permutation pp.

The second line of each test case contains nn integers a1,a2,…,ana1,a2,…,an (1≤ai≤⌈log2n⌉1≤ai≤⌈log2⁡n⌉ or ai=−1ai=−1) — the iteration number that element pipi is removed.

It is guaranteed that the sum of nn over all test cases does not exceed 2⋅1052⋅105.

It is guaranteed that there exists at least one permutation pp that satisfies array aa.
outputSpecHtml:
For each test case, output nn integers representing the elements of the permutation satisfying array aa.

If there are multiple solutions, you may output any of them.
noteHtml:
In the first test case, operations will be applied to permutation [3,2,1][3,2,1] as follows:

  1. The only local minimum in [3,2,1][3,2,1] is 11. Hence, elements 33 and 22 are removed. There is only one remaining element; hence the process terminates.

This satisfies array a=[1,1,−1]a=[1,1,−1] as both p1p1 and p2p2 were removed on iteration number 11, while p3p3 was not removed.

In the second test case, operations will be applied to permutation p=[4,3,5,1,2]p=[4,3,5,1,2] as follows:

  1. The local minima in [4,3,5,1,2][4,3,5,1,2] are 33 and 11. Hence, elements 44, 55, and 22 are removed.
  2. The only local maximum in [3,1][3,1] is 33. Hence, element 11 is removed. There is only one remaining element; hence the process terminates.

This satisfies array a=[1,−1,1,2,1]a=[1,−1,1,2,1] as elements p1=4p1=4, p3=5p3=5, and p5=2p5=2 were removed on iteration 11, element p4=1p4=1 was removed on iteration 22, and element p2=3p2=3 was not removed.

In the third test case, operations will be applied on permutation [6,7,2,4,3,8,5,1][6,7,2,4,3,8,5,1] as follows:

  1. The local minima in [6,7,2,4,3,8,5,1][6,7,2,4,3,8,5,1] are 66, 22, 33, and 11. Hence, elements 77, 44, 88, and 55 are removed.
  2. The local maxima in [6,2,3,1][6,2,3,1] are 66 and 33. Hence, elements 22 and 11 are removed.
  3. The only local minimum in [6,3][6,3] is 33. Hence, element 66 is removed. There is only one remaining element; hence the process terminates.

In the fourth test case, one permutation satisfying the constraints is [66, 55, 22, 11, 33, 44, 77]. 11 is the only local minimum, so only it will stay after the first iteration. Note that there are other valid permutations; for example, [66, 44, 33, 11, 22, 55, 77] would also be considered correct.
